Sentencas: Production of high performance low-energy loss solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) is a challenge and is the global demand of the current market.
Titulo: Deficiency of O2 molecules enhances ionic conductivity in Cr-doped O-Ce-O for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: We have focused on to develop SOFCs that can be operated at 600-800 degrees C with better ionic conductivity when compared to the conventional SOFCs functioning at 1000-800 degrees C. Bulk cerium oxide (CeO2)-based solid electrolyte lessens ionic conductivity at room temperature, thus nanocrystalline CeO2 has been used to improve the conductivity and to control the temperature.
Titulo: Deficiency of O2 molecules enhances ionic conductivity in Cr-doped O-Ce-O for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The transition metal-doped CeO2 (Ce(1-x)Cr(x)O2) nanocrystalline is used to increases the deficiency of oxygen molecules which in turn enhances ionic conductivity in electrolyte material for SOFC applications.
Titulo: Deficiency of O2 molecules enhances ionic conductivity in Cr-doped O-Ce-O for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The structural and morphological characterization have been done using XRD, RAMAN and FESEM, while electrical and magnetic characterization at room temperature was analysed using vibrating sample magnetometer, impedance spectroscopy and
Titulo: Deficiency of O2 molecules enhances ionic conductivity in Cr-doped O-Ce-O for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: cyclic voltammetery shows better ionic conductivity in Cr doped CeO2 in comparison with pure nanocrystalline CeO2.
Titulo: Deficiency of O2 molecules enhances ionic conductivity in Cr-doped O-Ce-O for solid oxide fuel cell applications
